title: Operations (The Future)
description: Future tense. Planning, proposing, scheduling, and conditional logic.

episodes.intro: You are no longer reporting the past. You are declaring intent. I will go. I will come. I will do.
episodes.scenario: Wife asks your plans. You say 'I will go to the market. I will come back. I will eat dinner'.

episodes.intro: Shall we? Should we? The proposal forms. Inviting action.
episodes.scenario: Friend asks 'Shall we go to the movie?'. You say 'Let's go'. He asks 'Shall we eat first?'. You agree.

episodes.intro: When will it happen? Tomorrow, next week, always, sometimes.
episodes.scenario: Boss asks when you will finish the report. You say 'Tomorrow'. He asks if you always work late. You say 'Sometimes'.

episodes.intro: If this, then that. The conditional logic. If you come, if it rains, if he goes.
episodes.scenario: Wife says 'If it rains, don't go'. You say 'If I have time, I will come early'.

episodes.intro: Planning a social outing with contingencies. You must propose a plan with two backup options.
episodes.scenario: Propose going to the beach. What if it rains? Go to the mall. When shall we go? Tomorrow morning. What if there is no time? We can see next week.

episodes.intro: Audit Day. Reviewing future tense and conditional logic.
episodes.scenario: Rapid fire. Build conditional sentences with future plans.

episodes.intro: Understanding Tamil time. Why 'I'm coming' means 'I haven't left yet'.
episodes.scenario: Understanding the progression: Varren (still at home) → Kilambitten (in transit) → Vandhutten (arrived). Learn to decode actual arrival time.
